item.title: Absence of Meaning in 'The Lighthouse'
item.description: All movies have to become real, on some level, in order to do their good work, and some of them can only achieve this by taking active steps to distance themselves from reality. All movies do this to some extent simply by appearing on a screen, but some of them, as with The Lighthouse, need a little more than that. Eggersâ€™s choice to shoot on 35mm negative in an aspect ratio of 1.
